pronunciation: CONSECRATE, [Latin , to consecrate sacred. See Sacred.]

definitions.text:
Consecrate
1. To make or declare be sacred, by certain ceremonies or rites; appropriate uses; set apart, dedicate, or devote, the service and worship of God; as, church.Thou shalt Aaron and his sons. Exodus 29:9.All the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated the Lord. Joshua 6:19.
2. To canonize; exalt the rank of saint; enroll among the gods, as Roman emperor.
3. To set apart and bless the elements the eucharist.
4. To render venerable; make respected; as, rules or principles consecrated by time.CONSECRATE,
Sacred; consecrated; devoted; dedicated.They were assembled that place.[This word is now seldom used, unless poetry.]
